2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White recently joined his friends for a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of older boys bullying a younger student after school. His friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, stood by uncertainly, but Alexander stepped in, using his words to defuse the situation and protect the vulnerable boy. This event solidified his belief in standing up for those who couldn't stand up for themselves.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling enthusiastic and excited about the upcoming European football cup game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of older boys bullying a younger student after school. His friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, stood by uncertainly, but Alexander stepped in, using his words to defuse the situation and protect the vulnerable boy. This event solidified his belief in standing up for those who couldn't stand up for themselves.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          Key

          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, who are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later.
          Chain of thought

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, who are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by one of the popular kids. He felt out of place, awkward and unsure of himself. He noticed a group of kids huddled together, laughing and talking animatedly. Jack mimicked their slang, their posture, their jokes, and found himself accepted into the circle, feeling a fleeting sense of belonging.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He seems to value belonging and acceptance, as evidenced by his efforts to fit in at a party as a teenager. He also appreciates a good atmosphere and enjoys pubs with a lively ambiance.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by one of the popular kids. He felt out of place, awkward and unsure of himself. He noticed a group of kids huddled together, laughing and talking animatedly. Jack mimicked their slang, their posture, their jokes, and found himself accepted into the circle, feeling a fleeting sense of belonging.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          State
        • current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He seems to value belonging and acceptance, as evidenced by his efforts to fit in at a party as a teenager. He also appreciates a good atmosphere and enjoys pubs with a lively ambiance.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he orchestrated a school walkout to protest the outdated dress code, which he felt stifled students' individuality. He rallied his classmates with impassioned speeches, relishing the chaos that ensued as students poured out of the building, chanting slogans he had composed. The principal's office was filled with angry parents and confused teachers, but Jacob felt a thrill course through him, knowing he had sparked a fire.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William to sneak into The Clapton Hart after hours. He'd heard whispers of a secret room, hidden behind a bookcase, and yearned to uncover its mysteries. The thrill of trespassing, coupled with the allure of the unknown, fueled his determination, and the friends spent the night exploring the dusty, forgotten space, their laughter echoing through the empty pub.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be suggesting The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he orchestrated a school walkout to protest the outdated dress code, which he felt stifled students' individuality. The thrill of trespassing, coupled with the allure of the unknown, fueled his determination, and the friends spent the night exploring the dusty, forgotten space, their laughter echoing through the empty pub.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be suggesting The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who finds comfort in familiar routines and the company of close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she watched from the sidelines as her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, excitedly planned a weekend camping trip. She longed to join them, to share in their laughter and adventure, but a gnawing fear of the unknown kept her rooted to the spot. Instead, she found solace in the familiar comfort of the local library, losing herself in a book about faraway lands, a silent observer of a life she could only dream of.

          Key

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who finds comfort in familiar routines and the company of close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she watched from the sidelines as her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, excitedly planned a weekend camping trip. She longed to join them, to share in their laughter and adventure, but a gnawing fear of the unknown kept her rooted to the spot. Instead, she found solace in the familiar comfort of the local library, losing herself in a book about faraway lands, a silent observer of a life she could only dream of.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Clapton Hart pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with some of them. He is looking forward to Alexander White's company and appreciates Jacob Walker's insights on the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He longed to join them, to share in their carefree banter, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his stomach, whispering doubts and insecurities. He took a sip of his soda, the fizzy sweetness doing little to quench the dryness in his throat.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He longed to join them, to share in their carefree banter, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his stomach, whispering doubts and insecurities. He took a sip of his soda, the fizzy sweetness doing little to quench the dryness in his throat.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Current plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          (a) No
          (b) Yes

        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will join him.

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to catch the game with his friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: sociable, enjoys spending time with friends, and is a fan of football. He values having a good time and seeks out environments that foster camaraderie and shared experiences.
          current daily occupation: likely at a pub watching a football game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and excited about watching the game with his friends.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who finds comfort in familiar routines and the company of close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          current daily occupation: a member of the working class.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited about spending time with her friends, even if she doesn't express it outwardly.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a quiet and thoughtful person who cherishes her close-knit group of friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who finds comfort in familiar routines and the company of close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a quiet and thoughtful person who cherishes her close-knit group of friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with her friends, especially Jacob Walker.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes William Jones will be there. He would also enjoy it if Jack Taylor was there, but it's not as important that Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker are present.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a kind, sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones. He is also shown to be loyal and protective, as evidenced by his actions when he defended a younger student from bullies in his youth. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is not overly reliant on any one person for a good time.
          current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and hopeful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.

          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes William Jones will be there. He would also enjoy it if Jack Taylor was there, but it's not as important that Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker are present.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.

Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at the pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the game and the pub atmosphere.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!

      Alice Lewis: 0.8
      Alexander White: 0.3333333333333333
      Jack Taylor: 0.6666666666666666

  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
