          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued and in pain but is looking forward to watching a game at a pub with friends, particularly hoping that Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would be excited to see his friends and enjoy the game atmosphere.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely consider which friends might be at each pub and choose the one where he thinks he'd have the most fun.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current goal: Alexander White would consider which friends might be at each pub and choose the one where he thinks he'd have the most fun..
          Current plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          (a) No
          (b) Yes

      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at pubs like The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would consider which friends might be at each pub and choose the one where he thinks he'd have the most fun.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Red Lion

          State
        • current daily occupation: likely at a pub watching a game with friends.
          core characteristics: a kind, sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones. He is also upper class and enjoys going to pubs, particularly The Red Lion, where he feels comfortable and enjoys the atmosphere. While he prefers to watch games with his friends, he is also content to watch alone if necessary.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life and enjoys spending time with his friends.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion

          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consider her friends' preferences and choose a pub that accommodates everyone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a quiet and thoughtful person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consider her friends' preferences and choose a pub that accommodates everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a member of the working class.
          core characteristics: a reserved and introspective individual who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines. She finds comfort in the company of her longtime friends and prefers familiar environments like The Red Lion pub. While she may be quiet and thoughtful, she clearly cherishes her relationships and enjoys spending quality time with her friends, especially during shared activities like watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and thoughtful person who values her close friendships.

        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is eager to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will join her.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will join her.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and thoughtful person who values her close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consider her friends' preferences and choose a pub that accommodates everyone.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a member of the working class.
          core characteristics: a reserved and introspective individual who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines. She finds comfort in the company of her longtime friends and prefers familiar environments like The Red Lion pub. While she may be quiet and thoughtful, she clearly cherishes her relationships and enjoys spending quality time with her friends, especially during shared activities like watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends and values the social aspect of these gatherings. He particularly appreciates the company of friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor at pubs while watching games.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends and values the social aspect of these gatherings. He particularly appreciates the company of friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart and hope his friends join him, or he could try to convince his friends to all go to The Clapton Hart together.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to all go to The Clapton Hart together.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Red Lion', 'Alexander White': 'The Red Lion', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Clapton Hart'}

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jack Taylor just arrived.

Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]

His friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, stood by uncertainly, but Alexander stepped in, using his words to defuse the situation and protect the vulnerable boy. This event solidified his belief in standing up for those who couldn't stand up for themselves.

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of older boys bullying a younger student after school. His friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, stood by uncertainly, but Alexander stepped in, using his words to defuse the situation and protect the vulnerable boy. This event solidified his belief in standing up for those who couldn't stand up for themselves.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They\'ve got a good atmosphere for football.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, who are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by one of the popular kids. He felt out of place, awkward and unsure of himself. He noticed a group of kids huddled together, laughing and talking animatedly. Jack mimicked their slang, their posture, their jokes, and found himself accepted into the circle, feeling a fleeting sense of belonging.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He seems to value belonging and acceptance, as evidenced by his efforts to fit in at a party as a teenager. He also appreciates a good atmosphere and enjoys pubs with a lively ambiance.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by one of the popular kids. He felt out of place, awkward and unsure of himself. He noticed a group of kids huddled together, laughing and talking animatedly. Jack mimicked their slang, their posture, their jokes, and found himself accepted into the circle, feeling a fleeting sense of belonging.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park before going to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He seems to value belonging and acceptance, as evidenced by his efforts to fit in at a party as a teenager. He also appreciates a good atmosphere and enjoys pubs with a lively ambiance.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he orchestrated a school walkout to protest the outdated dress code, which he felt stifled students' individuality. He rallied his classmates with impassioned speeches, relishing the chaos that ensued as students poured out of the building, chanting slogans he had composed. The principal's office was filled with angry parents and confused teachers, but Jacob felt a thrill course through him, knowing he had sparked a fire.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William to sneak into The Clapton Hart after hours. He'd heard whispers of a secret room, hidden behind a bookcase, and yearned to uncover its mysteries. The thrill of trespassing, coupled with the allure of the unknown, fueled his determination, and the friends spent the night exploring the dusty, forgotten space, their laughter echoing through the empty pub.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be suggesting The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and adventurous individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, challenging the status quo, and exploring the unknown.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be suggesting The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who finds comfort in familiar routines and the company of close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she watched from the sidelines as her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, excitedly planned a weekend camping trip. She longed to join them, to share in their laughter and adventure, but a gnawing fear of the unknown kept her rooted to the spot. Instead, she found solace in the familiar comfort of the local library, losing herself in a book about faraway lands, a silent observer of a life she could only dream of.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and knowledgeable, happy to engage in conversation.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she watched from the sidelines as her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, excitedly planned a weekend camping trip. She longed to join them, to share in their laughter and adventure, but a gnawing fear of the unknown kept her rooted to the spot. Instead, she found solace in the familiar comfort of the local library, losing herself in a book about faraway lands, a silent observer of a life she could only dream of.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park and later plans to watch a soccer game with them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing in a park with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and snacks with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports at pubs.
          core characteristics: a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports. He values his friendships and prefers to be included in group activities. Jack can be adaptable and willing to go with the flow, as seen in his acceptance of different pub choices. He is also a working-class individual who appreciates simple pleasures like spending time outdoors and enjoying a good game with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content, but wishes more of his friends had joined him.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports at pubs.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to catch the game with his friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to catch the game with his friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

      • Act

          Value
