          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to catch the game with his friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and company of his friends.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports at pubs.
          core characteristics: a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports. He values his friendships and prefers to be included in group activities. Jack can be adaptable and willing to go with the flow, as seen in his acceptance of different pub choices. He is also a working-class individual who appreciates simple pleasures like spending time outdoors and enjoying a good game with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content, but wishes more of his friends had joined him.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends at Victoria Park and watching football games, particularly at The Clapton Hart pub. He values the company of certain friends more than others, and appreciates insightful commentary during the games.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends at Victoria Park and watching football games, especially at The Clapton Hart pub. He prefers the company of some friends over others and enjoys insightful commentary during the games.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game later that evening.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones. He is also a loyal friend who stands up for those in need. Although he prefers to spend time with his friends, he is capable of enjoying himself alone. He appreciates comfortable surroundings and enjoys a good pub atmosphere.
          current daily occupation: likely retired, given his age and mention of leisure activities like watching games with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because none of his friends showed up to watch the game with him.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing in a park with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time:

          **Week of May 14th:**

          * **Friday, May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Meet Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob at The Red Lion to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **Saturday, May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Attend a local farmers market with friends or family.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Enjoy a relaxed dinner at home or try a new restaurant.
          * **Sunday, May 17th:**
          * [11:00 - 14:00] Go for a walk or bike ride in Victoria Park.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Have a barbecue with friends in the park, weather permitting.

          **Week of May 21st:**

          * **Friday, May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local pub quiz night with friends.
          * **Saturday, May 23rd:**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * **Sunday, May 24th:**
          * [12:00 - 15:00] Have a leisurely brunch with friends.

          **Remaining Weeks:**

          * Continue to prioritize spending time with friends and enjoying social activities.
          * Explore new restaurants, pubs, or entertainment options in the area.
          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          This is just a suggestion, and Alexander White may adjust his plan based on his preferences and any unexpected opportunities that arise.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones. He is also a loyal friend who stands up for those in need. Although he prefers to spend time with his friends, he is capable of enjoying himself alone. He appreciates comfortable surroundings and enjoys a good pub atmosphere.
          current daily occupation: likely retired, given his age and mention of leisure activities like watching games with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because none of his friends showed up to watch the game with him.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
    Active player

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at Victoria Park and a pub, watching soccer games and enjoying social gatherings. He seems to value the company of his friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones spent the previous day socializing with friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker, at Victoria Park and a pub, watching soccer and enjoying their company. He is currently continuing his day on May 16th.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones spent the previous day socializing with friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker, at Victoria Park and a pub, watching soccer and enjoying their company. He is currently continuing his day on May 16th.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at Victoria Park and a pub, watching soccer games and enjoying social gatherings. He seems to value the company of his friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.

          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are deciding which pub to go to watch the Moldova and Monaco game tonight.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with her friends, especially Jacob Walker.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a quiet and thoughtful person who cherishes her close-knit group of friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and engaging in lighthearted conversation.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective individual who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a quiet and thoughtful person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consider her friends' preferences and choose a pub that accommodates everyone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introspective individual who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines. She finds comfort in the company of her friends and prefers quiet settings like libraries and pubs. While she may be hesitant to step outside of her comfort zone, she cherishes the moments spent with her loved ones, finding joy in simple pleasures like sharing stories and enjoying a good game.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her close friends, particularly at pubs and watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consider her friends' preferences and choose a pub that accommodates everyone.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 22:00] Convince friends to go to The Red Lion to watch the game; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Meet friends for coffee and cake; [16 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local pub quiz with friends; [17 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Grocery shopping; [17 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit a museum or art gallery; [18 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and a movie with friends; [19 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Volunteer at a local charity; [19 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Read a book in the park; [20 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Attend a concert or live music event; [21 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home; [21 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Meet friends for lunch; [22 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends; [23 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Grocery shopping; [23 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit a local market; [24 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with friends; [25 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home; [25 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Go for a walk in the park; [26 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local theatre performance; [27 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Volunteer at a local charity; [27 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Read a book in the park; [28 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and a movie with friends; [29 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home; [29 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Meet friends for coffee and cake; [30 May 2015 19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends; [31 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Grocery shopping; [31 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introspective individual who values her close friendships and enjoys familiar routines. She finds comfort in the company of her friends and prefers quiet settings like libraries and pubs. While she may be hesitant to step outside of her comfort zone, she cherishes the moments spent with her loved ones, finding joy in simple pleasures like sharing stories and enjoying a good game.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her close friends, particularly at pubs and watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with his friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, the bustling atmosphere of the market, and perhaps a cup of coffee and a pastry.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time with friends in mind:

          **May 15th (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **May 16th (Saturday)**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or hobbies.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Dinner with friends at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 17th (Sunday)**

          * [11:00 - 13:00] Brunch with friends at a local cafe.
          * [15:00 - 17:00] Go for a walk in the park, enjoy the sunshine.

          **May 18th - 21st (Monday - Thursday)**

          * Focus on work/daily routines.

          **May 22nd (Friday)**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet up with friends for drinks at a different pub than usual, try something new.

          **May 23rd (Saturday)**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Attend a local festival or event with friends.
          * [20:00 - 22:00] Movie night at home with friends, snacks and popcorn.

          **May 24th (Sunday)**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Relaxing morning at home.

          **May 25th - 31st (Monday - Sunday)**

          * Continue with regular routines, incorporating social activities with friends as opportunities arise.

          This is just a suggestion, of course. Jack Taylor can adjust this plan based on his friends' availability and any other events or activities that come up. The key is to prioritize spending quality time with friends and enjoying himself.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and friendly working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching sports at pubs.
          current daily occupation: likely at a market with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and excited about spending time with his friends at the pub to watch the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild pain and is planning to watch a soccer game with friends tonight. They are deciding which pub to go to.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild pain and is planning to watch a soccer game with friends tonight. They are deciding which pub to go to.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

        • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and adventurous person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild pain and is planning to watch a soccer game with friends tonight. They are deciding which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market, but is also experiencing some mild pain.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to enjoy the moment with his friends while discreetly addressing the pain, perhaps by taking a break from the conversation or adjusting his position.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market, but is also experiencing some mild pain.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to enjoy the moment with his friends while discreetly addressing the pain, perhaps by taking a break from the conversation or adjusting his position.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got a good atmosphere for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. They have the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally part of a much larger estate belonging to the Beaumont family? It was only opened to the public in the late 19th century.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for heading to The Clapton Hart later for the game?"
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is a great pub. We should go there.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me. It's a great pub.
      Context for action selection and components
      • PomodoroHint

      • Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand
          Key

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          * Plan a weekend getaway or day trip to a nearby town or city.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
